column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/01/a-tale-of-two-bucs-reactions-buccaneers/|A Tale Of Two Bucs‚Äô Reactions|In life and in sports
column2: sometimes how a person reacts instantly to a situation says a lot about who they are ‚Äî and sometimes it‚Äôs completely unfair to judge that instant reaction. So the Bucs‚Äô gut-wrenching lost fumble at their own 12 yard line last Sunday was a massive turning point in Tampa Bay‚Äôs 23-20 loss to Washington. The fourth-quarter playcall was a jet sweep and Baker Mayfield and receiver Jalen McMillan botched the handoff exchange. Each immediately knew the play went wrong and the ball was in jeopardy. Mayfield‚Äôs reaction was to whip his body around and dive head first into the area of the ball. McMillan? He played spectator and drifted away from the play. Joe saw the very different responses from Mayfield and McMillan on replay
column3: but it really stood out again for Joe on an official Commanders mic‚Äôd up video segment that featured a different angle on the play. (The screenshot above is from that video). McMillan is No. 15; Mayfield is the guy who dove head first at Bobby Wagner and has his buttocks in the air. Is it fair to judge McMillan on his split-second decision? Sure
column4: but Joe‚Äôs not sure it‚Äôs worth making much of it. Regardless
column5: every team could use a few more guys wired like Mayfield. CHAOS! Baker loses the ball and it‚Äôs @Commanders ball in the red zone üëÄ üì∫: #WASvsTB on NBC üì±: Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/0Oq5lmBhsF ‚Äî NFL (@NFL) January 13

column2: defensive tackle Calijah Kancey had a lot on his plate.
